intro: Myosotis secunda subsp. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers and hairy stems and leaves, which give it its subspecies name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in cool, damp conditions. The hairy forget-me-not is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and conservation areas.
